segment.source: robstack - V2 of Deploy apps to computers
segment.target: robstack - V2 of Deploy apps to computers

segment.source: robstack - V2 of Deploy apps to computers
segment.target: robstack - V2 of Deploy apps to computers

segment.source: Now that you've learned the basics about app deployment, in this topic, you'll learn how to actually configure and deploy apps to Windows PCs you manage.
segment.target: Now that you've learned the basics about app deployment, in this topic, you'll learn how to actually configure and deploy apps to Windows PCs you manage.

segment.source: This generally involves three steps:
segment.target: This generally involves three steps:

segment.source: Configure the app
segment.target: Configure the app

segment.source: Deploy the app
segment.target: Deploy the app

segment.source: Monitor the app
segment.target: Monitor the app

segment.source: For information about how to update and retire apps, see Update apps using Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For information about how to update and retire apps, see Update apps using Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: The information in this topic helps you to deploy apps to Windows PCs that you manage using the client software.
segment.target: The information in this topic helps you to deploy apps to Windows PCs that you manage using the client software.

segment.source: If you want to deploy apps to enrolled Windows PCs and other mobile devices, see Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune - deleted.
segment.target: If you want to deploy apps to enrolled Windows PCs and other mobile devices, see Deploy apps to mobile devices in Microsoft Intune - deleted.

segment.source: Configure the app
segment.target: Configure the app

segment.source: In this procedure, you'll use the Intune Software Publisher to configure the properties of the app and upload it to your cloud storage space.
segment.target: In this procedure, you'll use the Intune Software Publisher to configure the properties of the app and upload it to your cloud storage space.

segment.source: To configure an app
segment.target: To configure an app

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administrator console, click Apps > Add Apps to start the Intune software publisher.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administrator console, click Apps > Add Apps to start the Intune software publisher.

segment.source: You might need to enter your Intune username and password before the publisher starts.
segment.target: You might need to enter your Intune username and password before the publisher starts.

segment.source: On the Software setup page of the software publisher, configure the following:
segment.target: On the Software setup page of the software publisher, configure the following:

segment.source: Select how this software is made available to devices - Choose Software installer, then specify:
segment.target: Select how this software is made available to devices - Choose Software installer, then specify:

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Select the software installer file type
segment.target: Select the software installer file type

segment.source: This indicates the type of software you want to deploy.
segment.target: This indicates the type of software you want to deploy.

segment.source: For a Windows PC, choose Windows Installer.
segment.target: For a Windows PC, choose Windows Installer.

segment.source: Specify the location of the software setup files
segment.target: Specify the location of the software setup files

segment.source: Enter the location of the installation files or click Browse to select the location from a list.
segment.target: Enter the location of the installation files or click Browse to select the location from a list.

segment.source: Include additional files and subfolders from the same folder
segment.target: Include additional files and subfolders from the same folder

segment.source: Some software that uses Windows Installer requires supporting files which are typically found in the same folder as the installation files.
segment.target: Some software that uses Windows Installer requires supporting files which are typically found in the same folder as the installation files.

segment.source: Select this option if you also want to deploy these supporting files.
segment.target: Select this option if you also want to deploy these supporting files.

segment.source: This installation type uses some of your cloud storage space.
segment.target: This installation type uses some of your cloud storage space.

segment.source: On the Software description page, configure the following:
segment.target: On the Software description page, configure the following:

segment.source: Depending on the installer file you are using, some of these values might have been automatically entered, or might not appear.
segment.target: Depending on the installer file you are using, some of these values might have been automatically entered, or might not appear.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Publisher
segment.target: Publisher

segment.source: Enter the name of the publisher of the app.
segment.target: Enter the name of the publisher of the app.

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Enter the name of the app as it will be displayed in the company portal.
segment.target: Enter the name of the app as it will be displayed in the company portal.

segment.source: Tip: Make sure all app names you use are unique.
segment.target: Tip: Make sure all app names you use are unique.

segment.source: If the same app name exists twice, only one of the apps will be displayed to users in the company portal.
segment.target: If the same app name exists twice, only one of the apps will be displayed to users in the company portal.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Enter a description for the app.
segment.target: Enter a description for the app.

segment.source: This will be displayed to users in the company portal.
segment.target: This will be displayed to users in the company portal.

segment.source: URL for software information
segment.target: URL for software information

segment.source: (optional) Enter a URL to a website that contains information about this app.
segment.target: (optional) Enter a URL to a website that contains information about this app.

segment.source: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.
segment.target: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.

segment.source: Privacy URL
segment.target: Privacy URL

segment.source: (optional) Enter a URL to a website that contains privacy information for this app.
segment.target: (optional) Enter a URL to a website that contains privacy information for this app.

segment.source: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.
segment.target: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.

segment.source: Category
segment.target: Category

segment.source: (optional) Select one of the built-in app categories.
segment.target: (optional) Select one of the built-in app categories.

segment.source: This will make it easier for users to find the app when they browse the company portal.
segment.target: This will make it easier for users to find the app when they browse the company portal.

segment.source: Icon
segment.target: Icon

segment.source: (optional) Upload an icon that will be associated with the app.
segment.target: (optional) Upload an icon that will be associated with the app.

segment.source: This is the icon that will be displayed with the app when users browse the company portal.
segment.target: This is the icon that will be displayed with the app when users browse the company portal.

segment.source: On the Requirements page, select the requirements that must be met before the app can start to install on a device from:
segment.target: On the Requirements page, select the requirements that must be met before the app can start to install on a device from:

segment.source: Architecture - Select whether this app can be installed on 32-bit, 64-bit, or both operating systems.
segment.target: Architecture - Select whether this app can be installed on 32-bit, 64-bit, or both operating systems.

segment.source: Operating System - Select the minimum operating system on which this app can be installed.
segment.target: Operating System - Select the minimum operating system on which this app can be installed.

segment.source: For the Windows Installer file type only (exe only): On the Detection rules page, you can configure rules to detect if the app you are configuring is already installed on a PC, or you can use the default detection rules to automatically overwrite any previously installed versions of the app.
segment.target: For the Windows Installer file type only (exe only): On the Detection rules page, you can configure rules to detect if the app you are configuring is already installed on a PC, or you can use the default detection rules to automatically overwrite any previously installed versions of the app.

segment.source: The rules you can configure are:
segment.target: The rules you can configure are:

segment.source: File exists - Specify the path to the file you want to detect.
segment.target: File exists - Specify the path to the file you want to detect.

segment.source: You can search under %ProgramFiles% (which searches Program Files\*<path>* and Program Files (x86)\*<path>*) on the PC or %SystemDrive% (which searches from the root drive of the PC, typically C:)
segment.target: You can search under %ProgramFiles% (which searches Program Files\*<path>* and Program Files (x86)\*<path>*) on the PC or %SystemDrive% (which searches from the root drive of the PC, typically C:)

segment.source: MSI product code exists - Click Browse to choose the Windows Installer (msi) file you want to detect.
segment.target: MSI product code exists - Click Browse to choose the Windows Installer (msi) file you want to detect.

segment.source: Registry key exists - Specify a registry key that begins with *HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\*.
segment.target: Registry key exists - Specify a registry key that begins with *HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\*.

segment.source: Both 32-bit and 64-bit registry paths are searched.
segment.target: Both 32-bit and 64-bit registry paths are searched.

segment.source: If the key you specified exists in either location, the detection rule is satisfied.
segment.target: If the key you specified exists in either location, the detection rule is satisfied.

segment.source: If the app satisfies any of the rules you have configured, it will not be installed.
segment.target: If the app satisfies any of the rules you have configured, it will not be installed.

segment.source: For the Windows Installer file type only (msi and exe): On the Command line arguments page, choose whether you want to supply optional command-line arguments for the installer.
segment.target: For the Windows Installer file type only (msi and exe): On the Command line arguments page, choose whether you want to supply optional command-line arguments for the installer.

segment.source: For example, some installers might support the argument /q to install silently with no user intervention.
segment.target: For example, some installers might support the argument /q to install silently with no user intervention.

segment.source: For the Windows Installer file type only (exe only): On the Return codes page, you can add new error codes that are interpreted by Intune when the app installs on a managed Windows PC.
segment.target: For the Windows Installer file type only (exe only): On the Return codes page, you can add new error codes that are interpreted by Intune when the app installs on a managed Windows PC.

segment.source: By default, uses industry-standard return codes to report the failure or success of an app package installation:
segment.target: By default, uses industry-standard return codes to report the failure or success of an app package installation:

segment.source: 0 - Success
segment.target: 0 - Success

segment.source: 3010 - Success with restart
segment.target: 3010 - Success with restart

segment.source: You can also add your own return codes to this list.
segment.target: You can also add your own return codes to this list.

segment.source: If you specify a list of return codes and the app installation returns a code that isn't on the list, it is interpreted as a failure.
segment.target: If you specify a list of return codes and the app installation returns a code that isn't on the list, it is interpreted as a failure.

segment.source: On the Summary page, review the information you specified.
segment.target: On the Summary page, review the information you specified.

segment.source: Once you are ready, click Upload.
segment.target: Once you are ready, click Upload.

segment.source: Click Close to finish.
segment.target: Click Close to finish.

segment.source: The app is displayed on the Apps node of the Apps workspace.
segment.target: The app is displayed on the Apps node of the Apps workspace.

segment.source: Deploy the app
segment.target: Deploy the app

segment.source: In this procedure, you'll deploy the app to selected devices or users.
segment.target: In this procedure, you'll deploy the app to selected devices or users.

segment.source: To deploy the app
segment.target: To deploy the app

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administrator console, click Apps > Apps to view the list of apps you manage.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administrator console, click Apps > Apps to view the list of apps you manage.

segment.source: Select the app you want to deploy, and then click Manage Deployment.
segment.target: Select the app you want to deploy, and then click Manage Deployment.

segment.source: In the <app name> dialog box, first, on the Select Groups page, choose the user or device groups to which you want to deploy the app.
segment.target: In the <app name> dialog box, first, on the Select Groups page, choose the user or device groups to which you want to deploy the app.

segment.source: On the Deployment Action page, configure the following:
segment.target: On the Deployment Action page, configure the following:

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Approval
segment.target: Approval

segment.source: Choose whether the deployment is:
segment.target: Choose whether the deployment is:

segment.source: - Required (mandatory install)
segment.target: - Required (mandatory install)

segment.source: - Available (users install from the company portal on demand)
segment.target: - Available (users install from the company portal on demand)

segment.source: - Not Applicable (the app is not installed or shown in the company portal)
segment.target: - Not Applicable (the app is not installed or shown in the company portal)

segment.source: - Uninstall (the app will be uninstalled from targeted devices)
segment.target: - Uninstall (the app will be uninstalled from targeted devices)

segment.source: Deadline
segment.target: Deadline

segment.source: For required installations, choose how soon the app will be deployed.
segment.target: For required installations, choose how soon the app will be deployed.

segment.source: You can choose from the predefined values, or select Custom to configure your own deadline.
segment.target: You can choose from the predefined values, or select Custom to configure your own deadline.

segment.source: Monitor the app
segment.target: Monitor the app

segment.source: You can see the apps you manage, and their deployment status in the console.
segment.target: You can see the apps you manage, and their deployment status in the console.

segment.source: To view the apps you manage and their status
segment.target: To view the apps you manage and their status

segment.source: In the Apps workspace, click the Apps node.
segment.target: In the Apps workspace, click the Apps node.

segment.source: The list of apps you manage will be displayed.
segment.target: The list of apps you manage will be displayed.

segment.source: You can click on any app to see an installation status in the lower pane of the console windows.
segment.target: You can click on any app to see an installation status in the lower pane of the console windows.

segment.source: Click on this status to see further details.
segment.target: Click on this status to see further details.

segment.source: For example, if the status shows 1 user has this software available, you can click the message to see the name of the user.
segment.target: For example, if the status shows 1 user has this software available, you can click the message to see the name of the user.

segment.source: You can use the Filters drop-down list to show only apps that meet the criteria you specify, like apps that failed to install, or apps that were successfully deployed.
segment.target: You can use the Filters drop-down list to show only apps that meet the criteria you specify, like apps that failed to install, or apps that were successfully deployed.

segment.source: Additionally, the Dashboard workspace shows an overview of the status of your apps.
segment.target: Additionally, the Dashboard workspace shows an overview of the status of your apps.

segment.source: If you click anywhere in the overview, you'll be taken to the list of apps.
segment.target: If you click anywhere in the overview, you'll be taken to the list of apps.

segment.source: To view more detailed information about an app
segment.target: To view more detailed information about an app

segment.source: In the list of apps, select any app, and then click View Properties.
segment.target: In the list of apps, select any app, and then click View Properties.

segment.source: On the Software Properties page for the app, click one of these tabs:
segment.target: On the Software Properties page for the app, click one of these tabs:

segment.source: General - Shows general information about the app and it's installation status.
segment.target: General - Shows general information about the app and it's installation status.

segment.source: Devices - Shows the devices that successfully installed a targeted deployment of the app.
segment.target: Devices - Shows the devices that successfully installed a targeted deployment of the app.

segment.source: Users - Shows the users who's devices successfully installed a targeted deployment of the app.
segment.target: Users - Shows the users who's devices successfully installed a targeted deployment of the app.

segment.source: As before, you can use the Filters drop-down list to configure the values shown on each of the tabs.
segment.target: As before, you can use the Filters drop-down list to configure the values shown on each of the tabs.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Deploy and configure apps with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Deploy and configure apps with Microsoft Intune
